text: hi friends yesterday one of my ex
students gave me a call after many years
and he said hi watch now I have to tell
you something and I was like go ahead
and he says I only got 85% in my
master's degree I was like okay I didn't
tell him anything I was speechless
trying to figure out what he actually
meant and he says aren't you happy I
mean eighty-five percent is not small
it's like wow so I said yes I am but he
said congratulate me and I did and then
again he said you know I'm really happy
because I only got 85 percent I couldn't
figure out what he meant so I asked him
what about your other friends he said
they didn't fare that well I only got 85
percent now I got what he was trying to
say only he got 85 percent I was a
little confused because I couldn't
figure out what he meant
I mean first he said I only got and then
he says 85 percent and congratulate me
so I wasn't I wasn't sure whether he was
happy about it he was complaining or
what the problem is
he used only wrongly so in today's
lesson I'm going to teach you how to use
only correctly okay now only is a
modifier
we call it a modifier because it
modifies what you want to say and it is
important how you place it in your
sentence
you may mean to say something and end up
saying something else if you do not use
the word only correctly all right so I'm
going to take you through a few
sentences with the uses of only alright
let's take a look at the first one only
I eat chocolates when I'm happy you see
this is what actually he meant to say
only I got 85% but what did he say I
only got so when I was confused and I
didn't understand or I you know I
couldn't really get what he was trying
to say so when I say only I eat now I'm
trying to say I'm the only one I me
myself right me so only is modifying I
that is why I have paste only before I
because it has to modify this only I and
no one else only I talk a--let's when
I'm happy I don't share it with anyone
else only I ate it
that means no one else only I so
remember you place only closest yeah to
the word that you want to modify all
right I hope this is clear
or let's take another example last night
we all avoid friends gathered at a party
only John came that means he did not
bring his wife along only John came
I cannot say John only came now a lot of
people use it this way but that's not
the correct way to say so when I want to
say it was only John he came alone I say
only John came to the party last night
all right let's take a look at another
use of only I only eat chocolates when I
am happy now a lot of people will say it
this way I eat only chocolates well this
is not wrong
but it has a totally different meaning
which we'll see in the next sentence so
now let's understand what do we mean by
I only eat now you're I own
well my mother makes lovely chocolates
either I go buy chocolates I don't make
them I only eat it
it is modifying eat here
okay now I'm up you're vegetarian all
right and my siblings love eating
chicken and lamp regularly I don't have
a choice I have to cook it for them so I
only cook I only cook you see only is
modifying the verb cook I do not buy it
I do not cut it I do not wash it that's
their job I do not eat it either I only
cook it so when I want to say that I
only do one thing you put only before
the word you modify so I only cook it
they go relish it they go buy it they go
wash it chop it I only cook it cook it
alright I hope this is clear to you
please remember what only before the
word that you want to modify all right
now in my third example I eat only
chocolates now you see the difference
I've canceled it here but that's exactly
what I've done in my next sentence I eat
only chocolates when I'm happy so when
I'm happy I only eat chocolates
modifying chocolates
no ice creams no brownies no pastries
only chocolates I don't need anything
else so when I'm happy I break all the
rules of my diet go and eat only
chocolates alright only is modifying
chocolates I eat only vegetarian food I
eat only tomatoes and carrots and
cucumber when I'm on a diet so that's
all I eat I only eat those three
vegetables alright I hope this is clear
to you again please remember I am
putting only just before what I am
modifying okay and the last example your
I eat chocolates okay
only when I'm happy if I'm not happy
I don't eat chocolates so it's a very
occasional thing alright so if I'm happy
every day I'm going to have chocolates
every day so I eat chocolates only when
I am modifying only when I'm happy if
I'm not happy no chocolates so only in
this situation am I going to open a bar
of chocolate and eat so I only eat
chocolates only when I'm happy so again
only is modifying the word of the
situation rather in this case only when
I'm happy if I am NOT happy no
chocolates okay friends so these are the
different uses of only what is important
is you place it before the word or the
situation that you wish to modify if you
do not use it correctly you will get
misinterpreted more often than not okay
